result.execSummary:
The defendant Julian Louis Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1- 1/2 years initial confinement.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to all sentences currently serving and Sawyer County Cases  19CF271 and 20CF190

superMiscConds.notes: $518.00 including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
8:21 AM Defendant Julian Louis Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Julian Louis Martin.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Chapman indicates DEF contacted Attny and wants to accept offer.   Plea Questionnaire electronically submitted to Court, completed with DEF by telephone, DEF agrees.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.  Court reviews information,  DEF enters Guilty plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1 and finds DEF guilty.   Count 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State makes statement prior to sentencing. Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.  Attny Chapman makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF no comment to court.   Court follows agreement.  

COURT:  3 years prison:  1 - 1/2 years initial confinement.  1- 1/2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent to any sentence currently serving and Case 19CF271 and 20CF190.   187 days credit.   Conditions of extended supervision:   No Contact with A.R.T.  dob:  10/11/1985.   Court Costs including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   DEF eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
